verses.text_plain: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
verses.verse_html:
1Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth. ▼
▼ to…: Heb. to morrow day

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to…: Heb. to morrow day

verses.text_plain: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.
verses.verse_html: 2Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

tokens.text: thee, and not thine own mouth

verses.text_plain: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.
verses.verse_html:
3A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both. ▼
▼ heavy: Heb. heaviness

verses.text_plain: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?
verses.verse_html:
4Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy? ▼
▼ Wrath…: Heb. Wrath is cruelty, and anger an overflowing
 , ▼
▼ envy: or, jealousy?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Wrath…: Heb. Wrath is cruelty, and anger an overflowing
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Wrath…: Heb. Wrath is cruelty, and anger an overflowing

verses.text_plain: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
verses.verse_html: 5Open rebuke is better than secret love.

verses.text_plain: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.verse_html:
6Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful. ▼
▼ deceitful: or, earnest, or, frequent

footnotes.body_html: ▼ deceitful: or, earnest, or, frequent

verses.text_plain: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
verses.verse_html:
7The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet. ▼
▼ loatheth: Heb. treadeth under foot

footnotes.body_html: ▼ loatheth: Heb. treadeth under foot

verses.text_plain: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
verses.verse_html: 8As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

verses.text_plain: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.
verses.verse_html:
9Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel. ▼
▼ by…: Heb. from the counsel of the soul

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by…: Heb. from the counsel of the soul
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by…: Heb. from the counsel of the soul

verses.text_plain: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.
verses.verse_html: 10Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

verses.text_plain: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
verses.verse_html: 11My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

verses.text_plain: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.
verses.verse_html: 12A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

verses.text_plain: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
verses.verse_html: 13Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

tokens.text: of him for a strange woman

verses.text_plain: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.
verses.verse_html: 14He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

verses.text_plain: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
verses.verse_html: 15A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.

verses.text_plain: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.
verses.verse_html: 16Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.

verses.text_plain: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.verse_html: 17Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

verses.text_plain: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.
verses.verse_html: 18Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

verses.text_plain: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
verses.verse_html: 19As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

verses.text_plain: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
verses.verse_html:
20Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied. ▼
▼ never: Heb. not

verses.text_plain: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.
verses.verse_html: 21As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.

verses.text_plain: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
verses.verse_html: 22Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.

verses.text_plain: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.
verses.verse_html:
23Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds. ▼
▼ look…: Heb. set thy heart

footnotes.body_html: ▼ look…: Heb. set thy heart

verses.text_plain: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?
verses.verse_html:
24For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation? ▼
▼ riches: Heb. strength
 , ▼
▼ to…: Heb. to generation and generation?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to…: Heb. to generation and generation?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to…: Heb. to generation and generation?

verses.text_plain: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.
verses.verse_html: 25The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.

verses.text_plain: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.
verses.verse_html: 26The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.

verses.text_plain: And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.
verses.verse_html:
27And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens. ▼
▼ maintenance: Heb. life
